intro: Bupleurum fruticescens var. elatius, commonly known as the greater burnet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a basal rosette of leaves and upright flowering stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are finely divided and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, giving them a silvery appearance. The plant is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
